column1: Im as stumped as you are!
column3: Stumped can mean being unable to think of an answer, and it also refers to an amputee being left with a stump.
column4: The sudden question left me stumped, with no answer in sight.
column5: After the accident, he had to adapt to life with a stump.

column3: Folded can mean to bend something, and it can also refer to a business that went out of operation.
column4: She carefully folded the letter before placing it in the envelope.
column5: The company folded after just one year of business due to lack of customers.

column1: He says he can stop anytime.
column3: Stop can mean to cease an action, and it can also refer to a physical stopping/halting.
column4: Please stop talking while I am trying to concentrate.
column5: The bus had to make an abrupt stop at the red light.

column3: Slider might refer to a type of small sandwich and also can mean something that moves smoothly along a surface.
column4: For lunch, I ordered a delicious slider filled with pulled pork.
column5: The slider on the drawer allows it to open and close effortlessly.

column3: Nightmares can mean frightening dreams, and it can also metaphorically refer to very bad situations or experiences.
column4: She often wakes up in the middle of the night due to terrible nightmares.
column5: The problems in the project turned out to be a nightmare for the entire team.
